thread.title: One problem with Texas A&M's 'Aggie Nights' uniforms ... game has an 11 a.m. kickoff
thread.title_full: One problem with Texas A&M's 'Aggie Nights' uniforms ... game has an 11 a.m. kickoff | Dallas Morning News

author: Brandon Wheeland
title: One problem with Texas A&M's 'Aggie Nights' uniforms ... game has an 11 a.m. kickoff
text:
Well, that didn't go as planned.
After a week of teasers on social media back in August , Texas A&M and Adidas announced a special "#AggieNights" uniform the Aggies would wear for their October 31 contest against the South Carolina Gamecocks.
Speed doesn’t take holidays. Another look at Texas A&M's #AggieNights uniform for Halloween. #12thMan #teamadidas pic.twitter.com/7Nwst8XkKq
— adidas Football US (@adidasFballUS) August 7, 2015
Take a closer look at the #AggieNights helmet from @hydrographics1 #12thMan #teamadidas pic.twitter.com/bEutPXxqSc
— Texas A&M Football (@AggieFootball) August 7, 2015 A special helmet that reflected the A&M logo inside of the state of Texas was among the uniform tricks that Adidas and A&M figured to be a delightful treat for the fans in attendance at Kyle Field on Halloween night.
Here's the problem: The SEC Week 9 TV schedule has been released , and the highly marketed uniforms designed for a night game are now set to be worn for an 11 a.m. kickoff.
Even if the game creeps toward the four-hour mark as it did last week against Alabama, it doesn't appear that the full effects of these uniforms will have a chance to be seen, at least not against the Gamecocks. A slow start to the season from South Carolina in addition to the recent departure of former head coach Steve Spurrier -- coupled with the Aggies recent 41-23 defeat at the hands of the Tide -- surely didn't help chances for a prime time slot.
Here's the reaction from around Twitter:
@TAMUequipment any way you guys could just save the black uniforms for LSU? Seems kinda silly for a day game.
— Capt. America (@Robert_White14) October 19, 2015
You would think that there would be a person in the A&M/Adidas marketing room who said "what if its not a night game?" You would be wrong
— Lucas Jackson (@CoolHand_Lucas) October 19, 2015
#hype poster for the @AggieFootball vs USC matchup on Halloween. @GBHunting @ADornburg pic.twitter.com/696kSgEzfd
— Chris Elam (@crchriselam) October 19, 2015
Maybe there was a typo and it's actually an 11 pm game.
— Jessica! (@JessicaVShark19) October 19, 2015
Day-Glo https://t.co/A20IZF2G5V
— cuppycup (@cuppycup) October 19, 2015 (h/t SB Nation for being first to report news )
